data.title: Appendix N+
data.meta_description: Over the years various D&D products have listed other works that have inspired them. The trend started with Gary Gygax's Appendix N and has seen a revival with some of the 5E products. Appendix N: Inspirational and Educational Reading - from the AD&D Dungeon Master's Guide. Gary Gygax's list of works that "were of particular…
data.text:
Over the years various D&D products have listed other works that have inspired them. The trend started with Gary Gygax’s Appendix N and has seen a revival with some of the 5E products.

Appendix N: Inspirational and Educational Reading – from the AD&D Dungeon Master’s Guide. Gary Gygax’s list of works that “were of particular inspiration” for him. [PG] links are available for free through Project Gutenberg.

Anderson, Poul

Three Hearts and Three Lions

The High Crusade

The Broken Sword

Bellairs, John

The Face in the Frost

Brackett, Leigh

Brown, Fredric

Burroughs, Edgar Rice

“Pellucidar” series [PG – 1 2]

Mars series [PG – 1 2 3 4 5]

Venus series

Carter, Lin

“World’s End” series

de Camp, L. Sprague

Lest Darkness Fall

The Fallible Fiend

et al

Inspirational Source Material – from the Moldvay Basic D&D Set “includes some books that might prove useful.” [I removed duplicate works and general authors from Appendix N unless a different specific work was mentioned]

Appendix D: Dungeon Master Inspiration – from the Fifth Edition Dungeon Master’s Guide. Designed to “help you become a better storyteller, writer, performer, and mapmaker”.
